result.execSummary:
The defendant Janarro Ramon Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Restitution is set at 0.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon may not carry or possess firearms/body armor and civil rights are suspended until they are restored.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: Serve  25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

supervisions.notes: The court orders a fine of $100.00 plus all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge by 2-1-2016 or a civil judgment shall be entered.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Janarro Ramon Bradley in court with attorney John c Glover.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by all parties.
AS to count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 22 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 9 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.    
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Serve  25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
-Defendant is advised as a convicted felon may not carry or possess firearms/body armor and civil rights are suspended until they are restored.
-Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration of Substance Abuse programs.
RECEIVED & FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
AS to count 3:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 8 days time served.  The court orders a fine of $100.00 plus all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge by 2-1-2016 or a civil judgment shall be entered.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Janarro Ramon Bradley in court with attorney John c Glover.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initially case was set for jury trial today and the victim as to counts 2 and 3 did not appear and the state requested a body attachment and the case was adjourned to 1-20-2016 for trial with 15CM3457.  
After additional negotiations the defendant accepted the state's offer to resolve.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 amended to Physical Abuse of a Child-Reckless Causation of Bodily Harm, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), a Class I felony.
As to counts 1 and 3:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court orders count 2 dismissed and read in for sentencing on 11-3-2015.
Also as part of resolution the court is moving to dismiss and in 15CM3457.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Body Attachment as to Shavon W. is ordered rescinded.  Case has resolved.
Court advised that witness had been subpoenaed and served.  Order for body attachment for defaulting witness.  BODY ATTACHMENT ISSUED as to Shavon W., dob 6-29-1979

Defendant Janarro Ramon Bradley in court with attorney John c Glover.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant also has 15CM3457 and is represented by Ramon Valdez.  The court will pass case for the  State and both counsels to meet to potentially resolve any issues and perhaps resolve the cases short of trial.
Case recalled.  The court is informed that there is no resolution.  The court will disallow the WHITTY evidence and the felony case remains on for trial on 10-26-2015.  If trial does not proceed on that day then the court will revisit motion for joinder and cases will proceed to trial on the same date. Jury trial date of 1-20-2016 is set.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Janarro Ramon Bradley in court with attorney John c Glover.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge previously received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38. Court VACATED Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates in branch 23. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates in branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received & Filed, Request for Substitution (post rotation) against Judge Kremers, Br. 36. Case set for a Hearing to address substitution on 6/23/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.

Defendant Janarro Ramon Bradley in court with attorney John c Glover.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
